text: One more question: does the number of parameters refer to the input dimension only, or to intermediates as well? E.g. suppose that f(x::Real)::Real computes a large matrix somewhere inside: should one use reverse diff then?

elements.text: One more question: does the number of parameters refer to the input dimension only, or to intermediates as well? E.g. suppose that f(x::Real)::Real computes a large matrix somewhere inside: should one use reverse diff then?

text: number of parameters is the number of things you want to get the gradient with respect to.

Forward mode has to run basically the code you wrote once for each of those.
(modulo some tricks)
